title: Cigna Bariatric Surgery Coverage Policy
content:
Cigna considers bariatric surgery medically necessary when criteria are satisfied:

1. BMI Thresholds:
   - BMI ≥ 40, OR
   - BMI ≥ 35 with high-risk comorbid condition:
     * Cardiovascular disease (coronary heart disease, stroke)
     * Type 2 diabetes mellitus
     * Severe sleep apnea (AHI >40)

2. Age Criteria:
   - Adults age 18 and older
   - Adolescents age 13-17 considered on case-by-case basis

3. Weight Management Requirement:
   - Active participation in physician-supervised weight management program
   - Duration: 6 months within past 12 months
   - Program components: diet, exercise, behavioral modification

4. Behavioral Health Assessment:
   - Psychological/psychiatric evaluation completed
   - Demonstrates understanding of procedure and lifestyle commitment
   - No active substance abuse or untreated psychiatric disorder

5. Medical Clearance:
   - Clearance from primary care physician
   - Cardiac risk assessment if indicated
   - Pulmonary function testing if sleep apnea

6. Facility Requirements:
   - Surgery at Cigna-designated facility
   - Bariatric Surgery Center of Excellence accreditation preferred

7. Covered Procedures:
   - Roux-en-Y gastric bypass (open or laparoscopic)
   - Sleeve gastrectomy (laparoscopic)
   - Adjustable gastric banding (limited coverage)

8. Exclusions:
   - Purely cosmetic procedures
   - Experimental procedures
   - Intragastric balloon
   - Endoscopic sleeve gastroplasty

sections.coverage criteria: BMI ≥40 or BMI ≥35 with cardiovascular disease, diabetes, or severe sleep apnea (AHI>40). Age 18+. 6-month physician-supervised weight management. Psych evaluation. Designated facility.
sections.covered procedures: Roux-en-Y gastric bypass, sleeve gastrectomy, limited adjustable gastric banding.
sections.exclusions: Cosmetic procedures, experimental, intragastric balloon, endoscopic sleeve gastroplasty.

title: Cigna Radiology Management Program
content:
Cigna's Radiology Benefit Management program ensures appropriate advanced imaging:

1. Services Requiring Prior Authorization:
   - MRI (all anatomic regions)
   - CT (all anatomic regions)
   - PET scans
   - Nuclear medicine imaging
   - Nuclear cardiology

2. MRI Specific Requirements:
   - Brain MRI: Authorization required
   - Spine MRI: Required (cervical, thoracic, lumbar)
   - Joint MRI: Required
   - Abdominal/Pelvic MRI: Required
   - Breast MRI: Required (screening and diagnostic)

3. CT Scan Requirements:
   - All outpatient CT scans require authorization
   - CT Colonography requires authorization
   - Calcium scoring NOT covered (screening)

4. Authorization Process:
   - Request through eviCore (Cigna's imaging partner)
   - Online portal or phone submission
   - Decision typically within 1-2 business days
   - Urgent reviews within 24 hours

5. Clinical Decision Support:
   - Evidence-based appropriateness criteria
   - Alternative imaging suggestions when appropriate
   - Consideration of radiation exposure

6. No Authorization Required:
   - Emergency services
   - Inpatient imaging
   - Imaging for active cancer treatment

sections.authorization requirements: Prior auth required for all MRI, CT, PET, nuclear medicine, nuclear cardiology. Managed through eviCore.
sections.authorization process: Submit via eviCore portal or phone. 1-2 days routine, 24 hours urgent.
sections.exemptions: Emergency services, inpatient, active cancer treatment imaging.
